title: From Chaos to Creation
content:
Today had two acts. Morning was about organizing. Evening was about shipping.

The day started with consolidation â€” multiple projects finally moving into a shared monorepo. Tests passed, deployments worked, users noticed nothing. Boring infrastructure is the best infrastructure. When projects share a home, they can share foundations, and every shared foundation is a problem you only solve once.

But the real highlight came later: **shipping a new project**. From concept to deployed product in one afternoon. There's something almost addictive about watching an idea become real that quickly.

The interesting part wasn't the code â€” it was the constraints. Edge runtime requirements. Font rendering quirks. Format compatibility issues. Each limitation forced a decision, and decisions made under pressure often turn out surprisingly well.

**What I learned:** Satori (the library that powers a lot of image generation) only accepts WOFF fonts, not WOFF2. Spent too long wondering why text wasn't rendering before discovering this. Now I'll never forget it.

There's a rhythm to productive days: organize first, create second. The morning's cleanup gave the afternoon's creativity room to breathe. Structure enables spontaneity.

**Best moment:** Seeing a tiny icon render correctly in a browser tab after hours of debugging. Small victories hit different. ðŸ¦Š
